info.text: The default category for questions shared in context '3.6 Partial Equations'.

questiontext.text:
Proper and improper fractions Ekte og uekte brøk


Frequently we find that an algebraic fraction appears in the form Ofte finner vi at en algebraisk brøk vises i formen

\[\text{ algebraic fraction algebraisk brøk } = {\hbox{ numerator teller }\over \hbox{ denominator nevner }}\]

where both numerator and denominator are polynomials. For example: der både teller og nevner er polynomer. For eksempel:

\(\displaystyle{{x^3+x^2+3x+7\over x^2+1}; \qquad {3x^2-2x+5\over x^2-7x+2}; \qquad {x\over x^4+1}.}\)

The degree of the numerator, \(n\) say, is the highest power occurring in the numerator. The degree of the denominator, \(d\) say, is the highest power occurring in the denominator. Graden til telleren, si \(n\), er det samme som den høyeste potensen i telleren. Graden av nevneren, si \(d\), er det samme som den høyeste potensen i nevneren.

If \(d>n\) the fraction is said to be proper ; the third expression above is such an example. Hvis \(d>n\) sies det at brøken er ekte ; det tredje uttrykket ovenfor er et slikt eksempel.

If \(d\le n\) the fraction is said to be improper ; the first and second expressions above are examples of this type. Hvis \(d\le n\) sies det at brøken er uekte ; det første og andre uttrykket ovenfor er eksempler på denne typen.

Before calculating the partial fractions of an algebraic fraction it is important to decide whether the fraction is proper or improper. Før du beregner delbrøkene av en algebraisk brøk, er det viktig å avgjøre om brøken er ekte eller uekte.

The denominator of an algebraic fraction can often be factorised into a product of linear and/or irreducible quadratic factors. Before we can separate algebraic fractions into simpler (partial) fractions we need to completely factorise the denominators into linear and irreducible quadratic factors. Nevneren til en algebraisk brøk kan ofte faktoriseres til et produkt av lineære og/eller ikke reduserbare kvadratiske faktorer. Før vi kan skille algebraiske brøker i enklere (del)brøker, må vi faktorisere nevnerne fullstendig til lineære og ikke reduserbare kvadratiske faktorer.

Linear factors are those of the form \(ax+b\); for example \(2x+7\), \(3x-2\) and \(4-x\). Lineære faktorer er faktorer formen \(ax+b\); for eksempel \(2x+7\), \(3x-2\) og \(4-x\).

Irreducible quadratic factors are those of the form \(ax^2+bx+c\) such as \(x^2+x+1\), and \(4x^2-2x+3\), which cannot be factorised into linear factors (these are real quadratics with complex roots). Ikke reduserbare kvadratiske faktorer er de på formen \(ax^2+bx+c\) som for eksempel \(x^2+x+1\), og \(4x^2-2x+3\), som ikke kan faktoriseres til lineære faktorer (disse er reelle kvadrater med komplekse røtter).

Proper Fractions with Linear Factors Ekte brøker med lineære faktorer


Firstly we describe how to calculate partial fractions for proper fractions where the denominator may be written as a product of linear factors. The steps are as follows: Først beskriver vi hvordan man beregner delbrøker for ekte brøker der nevneren kan skrives som et produkt av lineære faktorer. Trinnene er som følger:

  • Factorise the denominator. Faktoriser nevneren.
  • Each factor will produce a partial fraction. A factor such as \(3x+2\) will produce a partial fraction of the form \(\dfrac{A}{3x+2}\) where \(A\) is an unknown constant. In general a linear factor \(ax+b\) will produce a partial fraction \(\dfrac{A}{ax+b}\) . The unknown constants for each partial fraction may be different and so we will call them \(A\) , \(B\) , \(C\) and so on. Hver faktor vil produsere en delbrøk. En faktor som \(3x+2\) vil produsere en delbrøk på formen \(\dfrac{A}{3x +2}\) der \(A\) er en ukjent konstant. Generelt vil en lineær faktor \(ax+b\) altså produsere en delbrøk \(\dfrac{A}{ax+b }\) . De ukjente konstantene for hver delbrøk kan være forskjellige, og derfor vil vi kalle dem \(A\) , \(B\) , \(C\) og så videre.
  • Evaluate the unknown constants by equating coefficients or using specific values of \(x\) . Finn de ukjente konstantene ved å likestille koeffisienter eller bruke spesifikke verdier av \(x\) .

The sum of the partial fractions is identical to the original algebraic fraction for all values of \(x\) . Summen av delbrøkene er identisk med den opprinnelige algebraiske brøken for alle verdier av \(x\) .


Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A linear factor \(ax+b\) in the denominator gives rise to a single partial fraction of the form \(\dfrac{A}{ax+b}\) . En lineær faktor \(ax+b\) i nevneren gir opphav til en enkel delbrøk på formen \(\dfrac{ A}{ax+b}\) .


The steps involved in expressing a proper fraction as partial fractions are illustrated in the following Example. Trinnene involvert i å uttrykke en ekte brøk som en delbrøk er illustrert i følgende eksempel.

Example Eksempel

Express \(\dfrac{7x+10}{ 2x^2+5x+3}\) in terms of partial fractions. Uttrykk \(\dfrac{7x+10}{ 2x^2+5x+3}\) i form av delbrøker.

Solution Løsning

Note that this fraction is proper. The denominator is factorised to give \((2x+3)(x+1)\) . Each of the linear factors produces a partial fraction. The factor \(2x+3\) produces a partial fraction of the form \(\dfrac{A}{2x+3}\) and the factor \(x+1\) produces a partial fraction \(\dfrac{B}{x+1}\) , where \(A\) and \(B\) are constants which we need to find. We write Merk at denne brøken er ekte. Nevneren er faktorisert slik at vi har \((2x+3)(x+1)\) . Hver av de lineære faktorene produserer en delbrøk. Faktoren \(2x+3\) produserer en delbrøk på formen \(\dfrac{A}{2x+3} \) og faktoren \(x+1\) produserer en delbrøk \(\dfrac{B}{ x+1}\) , der \(A\) og \(B\) er konstanter som vi trenger å finne. Vi skriver

\[\dfrac{7x+10}{(2x+3)(x+1)} = \dfrac{A}{2x+3} + \dfrac{B}{x+1}\]

By multiplying both sides by \((2x+3)(x+1)\) we obtain Ved å multiplisere begge sider med \((2x+3)(x+1)\) får vi

\[7x+10 = A(x+1) + B(2x+3)\qquad(*)\]

We may now let \(x\) take any value we choose . By an appropriate choice we can simplify the right-hand side. Let \(x=-1\) because this choice eliminates Vi kan nå la \(x\) ta en hvilken som helst verdi vi velger . Ved et passende valg kan vi forenkle høyre side. La \(x=-1\) fordi dette valget eliminerer \(A\) . We find Vi får \[\begin{aligned} 7(-1) + 10 &= A(0) + B(-2+3)\\ 3&=B \end{aligned}\] so that the constant \(B\) must equal 3. The constant \(A\) can be found either by substituting some other value for \(x\) or alternatively by ‘equating coefficients’. Observe that, by rearranging the right-hand side, Equation (*) can be written as slik at konstanten \(B\) må være lik 3. Konstanten \(A\) kan finnes enten ved å erstatte \(x\) med en annen verdi eller alternativt ved å «likstille koeffisienter». Legg merke til at ved å omorganisere høyre side, kan ligning (*) skrives som

\[7x+10 = (A+2B)x + (A+3B)\]

Comparing the coefficients of \(x\) on both sides we see that \(7=A+2B\) . We already know \(B=3\) and so Ved å sammenligne koeffisientene til \(x\) på begge sider ser vi at \(7=A+2B\) . Vi vet allerede at \(B=3\) så \[\begin{aligned} 7&=A + 2(3)\\ &= A+ 6\end{aligned}\] from which som gir \(A=1\) . We can therefore write Vi kan dermed skrive

\[\dfrac{7x+10}{2x^2+5x+3} = \dfrac{1}{2x+3} + \dfrac{3}{x+1}\]

We have succeeded in expressing the given fraction as the sum of its partial fractions. The result can always be checked by adding the fractions on the right. Vi har lyktes med å uttrykke den gitte brøken som summen av dens delbrøker. Resultatet kan alltid kontrolleres ved å legge sammen brøkene til høyre.

name.text: 3.6.2.4_Example_Express a fraction in terms of partial fractions

questiontext.text:
Example

Express \(\dfrac{7x+10}{ 2x^2+5x+3}\) in terms of partial fractions.

Solution

Note that this fraction is proper. The denominator is factorised to give \((2x+3)(x+1)\) . Each of the linear factors produces a partial fraction. The factor \(2x+3\) produces a partial fraction of the form \(\dfrac{A}{2x+3}\) and the factor \(x+1\) produces a partial fraction \(\dfrac{B}{x+1}\) , where \(A\) and \(B\) are constants which we need to find. We write

\[\dfrac{7x+10}{(2x+3)(x+1)} = \dfrac{A}{2x+3} + \dfrac{B}{x+1}\]

By multiplying both sides by \((2x+3)(x+1)\) we obtain

\[7x+10 = A(x+1) + B(2x+3)…(*)\]

We may now let \(x\) take any value we choose . By an appropriate choice we can simplify the right-hand side. Let \(x=-1\) because this choice eliminates \(A\) . We find \[\begin{aligned} 7(-1) + 10 &= A(0) + B(-2+3)\\ 3&=B \end{aligned}\] so that the constant \(B\) must equal 3. The constant \(A\) can be found either by substituting some other value for \(x\) or alternatively by ‘equating coefficients’. Observe that, by rearranging the right-hand side, Equation (*) can be written as

\[7x+10 = (A+2B)x + (A+3B)\]

Comparing the coefficients of \(x\) on both sides we see that \(7=A+2B\) . We already know \(B=3\) and so \[\begin{aligned} 7&=A + 2(3)\\ &= A+ 6\end{aligned}\] from which \(A=1\) . We can therefore write

\[\dfrac{7x+10}{2x^2+5x+3} = \dfrac{1}{2x+3} + \dfrac{3}{x+1}\]

We have succeeded in expressing the given fraction as the sum of its partial fractions. The result can always be checked by adding the fractions on the right.

name.text: 3.6.3.1 Proper fractions with repeated linear factors

questiontext.text:
Proper fractions with repeated linear factors Ekte brøker med flere like lineære faktorer


Sometimes a linear factor appears more than once. For example in Noen ganger er en lineær faktor med mer enn én gang. For eksempel i

\(\dfrac{1}{x^2+2x+1}=\dfrac{1}{(x+1)(x+1)}\) which equals som er lik \(\dfrac{1}{(x+1)^2}\)

the factor \((x+1)\) occurs twice. We call it a repeated linear factor . The repeated linear factor \((x+1)^2\) produces two partial fractions of the form \(\dfrac{A}{x+1} + \dfrac{B}{(x+1)^2}\) . In general, a repeated linear factor of the form \((ax+b)^2\) generates two partial fractions of the form faktoren \((x+1)\) forekommer to ganger. Vi kaller dette en gjentatt lineær faktor . Den gjentatte lineære faktoren \((x+1)^2\) produserer to delbrøker på formen \(\dfrac{A }{x+1} + \dfrac{B}{(x+1)^2}\) . Generelt vil en gjentatt lineær faktor på formen \((ax+b)^2\) generere to delbrøker på formen

\[\dfrac{A}{ax+b} + \dfrac{B}{(ax+b)^2}\]

This is reasonable since the sum of two such fractions always gives rise to a proper fraction: Dette er rimelig siden summen av to slike brøker alltid gir opphav til en ekte brøk:

\[\dfrac{A}{ax+b} + \dfrac{B}{(ax+b)^2}=\dfrac{A(ax+b)}{(ax+b)^2}+\dfrac{B}{(ax+b)^2}= \dfrac{x(Aa)+Ab+B}{(ax+b)^2}\]


Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A repeated linear factor \((ax+b)^2\) in the denominator produces two partial fractions: En gjentatt lineær faktor \((ax+b)^2\) i nevneren produserer to delbrøker:

\[\dfrac{A}{ax+b} + \dfrac{B}{(ax+b)^2}\]


Once again the unknown constants are found by either equating coefficients and/or substituting specific values for \(x\). Nok en gang blir de ukjente konstantene funnet ved enten å likestille koeffisienter og/eller sette inn spesifikke verdier for \(x\).

Proper fractions with quadratic factors Ekte brøker med kvadratiske faktorer


Sometimes when a denominator is factorised it produces a quadratic term which cannot be factorised into linear factors. One such quadratic factor is \(x^2+x+1\) . This factor produces a partial fraction of the form \(\dfrac{Ax+B}{x^2+x+1}\) . In general a quadratic factor of the form \(ax^2+bx+c\) produces a single partial fraction of the form \(\dfrac{Ax+B}{ax^2+bx+c}\) . Noen ganger når en nevner er faktorisert, produserer den en kvadratisk faktor som ikke kan faktoriseres til lineære faktorer. En slik kvadratisk faktor er for eksempel \(x^2+x+1\) . Denne faktoren produserer en delbrøk på formen \(\dfrac{Ax+B}{x^2+x+1}\) . Generelt gir en kvadratisk faktor på formen \(ax^2+bx+c\) en enkel delbrøk på formen \(\dfrac{Ax+B}{ax^2+bx+c}\) .


Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

A quadratic factor \(ax^2+bx+c\) in the denominator produces a partial fraction of the form \[\dfrac{Ax+B}{ax^2+bx+c}\] En kvadratisk faktor \(ax^2+bx+c\) i nevneren produserer en delbrøk på formen \[\dfrac {Ax+B}{ax^2+bx+c}\]

Example

Express as partial fractions

\[\dfrac{2x^2-x-2}{x+1}\]

Solution

The fraction is improper because \(n=2\) , \(d=1\) and so \(d\le n\) . Here \(n-d=1\) , so we need to include as an extra term a polynomial of the form \(Bx+C\) , in addition to the usual partial fractions. The linear term in the denominator gives rise to a partial fraction \(\dfrac{A}{x+1}\) . So altogther we have

\[\dfrac{2x^2-x-2}{x+1}= \dfrac{A}{x+1}+ (Bx+C)\]

Multiplying both sides by \(x+1\) we find

\[2x^2-x-2 = A+(Bx+C)(x+1) = Bx^2 + (C+B)x + (C+A)\]

Equating coefficients of \(x^2\) gives

\[B=2\].

Equating coefficients of \(x\) gives

\[-1=C+B\]

and so

\[C=-1-B=-3\].

Equating the constant terms gives

\[-2=C+A\]

and so

\[A=-2-C=-2-(-3)=1\].

Finally, we have

\[\dfrac{2x^2-x-2}{x+1}= \dfrac{1}{x+1}+2x-3\]

Engineering Example

Admittance

Admittance, \(Y\), is a quantity which is used in analysing electronic circuits. A typical expression for admittance is \[ Y(s) = {s^2+4s+5\over (s^2+2s+4)(s+3)}\] where \(s\) can be thought of as representing frequency. To predict the behaviour of the circuit it is often necessary to express the admittance as the sum of its partial fractions and find the effect of each part separately. Express \(Y(s)\) in partial fractions.

The fraction is proper. The denominator contains an irreducible quadratic factor, which cannot be factorised further, and also a linear factor. Thus \[{s^2+4s+5\over (s^2+2s+4)(s+3)} = {As+B\over s^2+2s+4} + {C\over s+3} \qquad \qquad \qquad (1) \] Multiplying both sides of Equation (1) by \((s^2+2s+4)(s+3)\) we obtain \[ s^2+4s+5 = (As+B)(s+3) + C(s^2+2s+4) \qquad \qquad \qquad (2) \] To find the constant \(C\) we let \(s=-3\) in Equation (2) to eliminate \(A\) and \(B\). Thus \[ (-3)^2+4(-3)+5 = C((-3)^2+2(-3)+4)\] so that \[ 2 = 7C\qquad \text{and so}\qquad C={2\over 7}\] Equating coefficients of \(s^2\) in Equation (2) we find \( 1= A+C\) so that \(A=1-C= 1-\displaystyle{2\over 7} = \displaystyle{5\over 7}\). Equating constant terms in Equation (2) gives \( 5=3B+4C\) so that \[{3B=5-4C=5-4\left({2\over 7}\right)={27\over 7}}\] so \[ B=\displaystyle{9\over 7}\] Finally\[{Y(s) = {s^2+4s+5\over (s^2+2s+4)(s+3)} = {{5\over 7}s + {9\over 7} \over s^2+2s+4} + {{2\over 7}\over s+3}}\] which can be written as \[{Y(s) = {5s+9\over 7(s^2+2s+4)} + {2\over 7(s+3)}}\]

Improper fractions Uekte brøker


When calculating the partial fractions of improper fractions an extra polynomial is added to any partial fractions that would normally arise. The added polynomial has degree \(n-d\) where \(n\) is the degree of the numerator and \(d\) is the degree of the denominator. Recall that Ved beregning av delbrøker av uekte brøker legges et ekstra polynom til eventuelle delbrøker som normalt ville oppstå. Det tilføyde polynomet har graden \(n-d\) der \(n\) er graden til telleren og \(d\) er graden til nevneren. Husk at

  • a polynomial of degree 0 is a constant, et polynom av grad 0 er en konstant, \(A\) say, for eksempel,
  • a polynomial of degree 1 has the form et polynom av grad 1 har formen \(Ax+B\) ,
  • a polynomial of degree 2 has the form et polynom av grad 2 har formen \(Ax^2+Bx+C\)

and so on. If, for example, the improper fraction is such that the numerator has degree 5 and the denominator has degree 3, then \(n-d=2\) , and we need to add a polynomial of the form og så videre. Hvis for eksempel den uekte brøken er slik at telleren har grad 5 og nevneren har grad 3, så er \(n-d=2\) , og vi må dermed legge til et polynom av formen \(Ax^2+Bx+C\) .


Key Point Nøkkelpunkt

If a fraction is improper an additional term is included taking the form of a polynomial of degree \(n-d\), where \(n\) is the degree of the numerator and \(d\) is the degree of the denominator. Hvis en brøk er uekte, inkluderes et tilleggsledd i form av et polynom av grad \(n-d\), der \(n\) er graden til telleren og \(d\) er graden til nevneren.

Example Eksempel

Express as partial fractions Delbrøksoppspalt

\[\dfrac{2x^2-x-2}{x+1}\]

Solution Løsning

The fraction is improper because \(n=2\) , \(d=1\) and so \(d\le n\) . Here \(n-d=1\) , so we need to include as an extra term a polynomial of the form \(Bx+C\) , in addition to the usual partial fractions. The linear term in the denominator gives rise to a partial fraction \(\dfrac{A}{x+1}\) . So altogether we have Brøken er uekte fordi \(n=2\) , \(d=1\) så \(d\le n\) . Her er \(n-d=1\) , så vi må inkludere som et ekstraledd et polynom på formen \(Bx+C \) , i tillegg til de vanlige delbrøkene. Det lineære leddet i nevneren gir opphav til en delbrøk \(\dfrac{A}{x+1}\) . Så alt i alt har vi

\[\dfrac{2x^2-x-2}{x+1}= \dfrac{A}{x+1}+ (Bx+C).\]

Multiplying both sides by \(x+1\) we find Ved å multiplisere begge sider med \(x+1\) finner vi

\[2x^2-x-2 = A+(Bx+C)(x+1) = Bx^2 + (C+B)x + (C+A).\]

Equating coefficients of \(x^2\) gives Å likestille koeffisientene til \(x^2\) gir

\[B=2.\]

Equating coefficients of \(x\) gives Å likestille koeffisientene til \(x\) gir

\[-1=C+B\]

and so så

\[C=-1-B=-3.\]

Equating the constant terms gives Likestille konstantleddet gir

\[-2=C+A\]

and so så

\[A=-2-C=-2-(-3)=1.\]

Finally, we have Endelig har vi

\[\dfrac{2x^2-x-2}{x+1}= \dfrac{1}{x+1}+2x-3.\]

name.text: 3.6.1.2_Task_State the degree of the numerator and denominator

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

For each of the following fractions state the degree of the numerator \((= n)\) and the degree of the denominator \((= d)\). Hence classify the fractions as proper or improper. For hver av de følgende brøkene oppgi graden til telleren \((= n)\) og graden til nevneren \((= d)\). Klassifiser deretter brøkene som ekte eller uekte.

  1. \(\displaystyle {@seq4[1][1]@}\)

    \(n =\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

    \(d =\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

    The function is Funkjsonen er [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

  2. \(\displaystyle {@seq4[2][1]@}\)

    \(n =\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]]

    \(d =\) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]][[feedback:prt5]]

    The function is Funksjonen er [[input:ans6]] [[validation:ans6]][[feedback:prt6]]

  3. \(\displaystyle {@seq4[3][1]@}\)

    \(n =\) [[input:ans7]] [[validation:ans7]][[feedback:prt7]]

    \(d =\) [[input:ans8]] [[validation:ans8]][[feedback:prt8]]

    The function is Funksjonen er [[input:ans9]] [[validation:ans9]][[feedback:prt9]]

  4. \(\displaystyle {@seq4[4][1]@}\)

    \(n =\) [[input:ans10]] [[validation:ans10]][[feedback:prt10]]

    \(d =\) [[input:ans11]] [[validation:ans11]][[feedback:prt11]]

    The function is Funksjonen er [[input:ans12]] [[validation:ans12]][[feedback:prt12]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. The degree of the numerator, \(n\) is \({@seq4[1][2]@}\). Graden til telleren, \(n\) er \({@seq4[1][2]@}\).


    The degree of the denominator, \(d\) is \({@seq4[1][3]@}\). Graden til nevneren, \(d\) er \({@seq4[1][3]@}\).


    Because \({@seq4[1][5]@}\) the fraction is \({@seq4[1][6]@}\). Fordi \({@seq4[1][5]@}\) er brøken \({@seq4[1][6]@}\).


  2. The degree of the numerator, \(n\) is \({@seq4[2][2]@}\). Graden til telleren, \(n\) er \({@seq4[2][2]@}\).


    The degree of the denominator, \(d\) is \({@seq4[2][3]@}\). Graden til nevneren, \(d\) er \({@seq4[2][3]@}\).


    Because \({@seq4[2][5]@}\) the fraction is \({@seq4[2][6]@}\). Fordi \({@seq4[2][5]@}\) er brøken \({@seq4[2][6]@}\).


  3. The degree of the numerator, \(n\) is \({@seq4[3][2]@}\). Graden til telleren, \(n\) er \({@seq4[3][2]@}\).


    The degree of the denominator, \(d\) is \({@seq4[3][3]@}\). Graden til nevneren, \(d\) er \({@seq4[3][3]@}\).


    Because \({@seq4[3][5]@}\) the fraction is \({@seq4[3][6]@}\). Fordi \({@seq4[3][5]@}\) er brøken \({@seq4[3][6]@}\).


  4. The degree of the numerator, \(n\) is \({@seq4[4][2]@}\). Graden til telleren, \(n\) er \({@seq4[4][2]@}\).


    The degree of the denominator, \(d\) is \({@seq4[4][3]@}\). Graden til nevneren, \(d\) er \({@seq4[4][3]@}\).


    Because \({@seq4[4][5]@}\) the fraction is \({@seq4[4][6]@}\). Fordi \({@seq4[4][5]@}\) brøken er \({@seq4[4][6]@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express \[{@wholeExp1@}\] in partial fractions. Uttrykk \[{@wholeExp1@}\] som sum av delbrøker.

First factorise the denominator (find \({@factor1@}\) and \({@factor2@}\) so that \({@expDenom1@}={@textExp@}\)): Faktoriser først nevneren (finn \({@faktor1@}\) og \({@faktor2@}\) slik at \({@expDenom1@}={@faktor1faktor2@}\)):


\({@expDenom1@}=\)[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

Because there are two linear factors we write this as: Siden det er to lineære faktorer, skriver vi dette som:

\[\dfrac{\text{numerator}}{\text{denominator}}=\dfrac{{@var2@}}{{@factor1@}}+\dfrac{{@var3@}}{{@factor2@}}\] \[\dfrac{\text{teller}}{\text{nevner}}=\dfrac{{@var2@}}{{@faktor1@}}+\dfrac{{@var3@}}{{@faktor2@}}\]

Multiply both sides by \({@textExp@}\) to obtain the equation from which to find \({@var2@}\) and \({@var3@}\): Multipliser begge sider med \({@textExp@}\) for å få ligningen som kan finne \({@var2@}\) og \({@var3@}\):


\({@expNum1@}=\)[[input:ans2]][[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]


Substitute an appropriate value for \({@var@}\) to obtain \({@var2@}\): Sett inn en passende verdi for \({@var@}\) for å få \({@var2@}\):


Substitute \({@var@}=\) Substituer \({@var@}=\) [[input:ans3]][[validation:ans3]] and get og få \({@var2@}=\)[[input:ans4]].[[validation:ans4]]

[[feedback:prt3]][[feedback:prt4]]

Equating coefficients of \({@var@}\) obtain the value of \({@var3@}\): Ved å likestille koeffisientene til \({@var@}\) får du verdien av \({@var3@}\):


\({@var3@}=\)[[input:ans5]].[[validation:ans5]]

[[feedback:prt5]]

Finally, write down the partial fractions: Skriv til slutt ned delbrøkene:


\(\displaystyle{{@wholeExp1@}=}\)[[input:ans6]].[[validation:ans6]]

[[feedback:prt6]]

generalfeedback.text:
Factorising the denominator we obtain \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\). Ved å faktorisere nevneren får vi \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\).

We can see then that \(\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{{@expDenom1@}}=\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}\). Vi kan da se at \(\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{{@expDenom1@}}=\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}\).

We want to express the right hand side as a sum of two fractions. This means, we need to find expessions \({@var2@}\) and \({@var3@}\) such that Vi ønsker å uttrykke høyre side som en sum av to brøker. Dette betyr at vi må finne \({@var2@}\) og \({@var3@}\) slik at

\[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}=\dfrac{{@var2@}}{{@exp1@}}+\dfrac{{@var3@}}{{@exp2@}}\]

Multiplying both sides of the expression by \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\) we obtain Ved å multiplisere begge sider av uttrykket med \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\) får vi

\[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}({@exp1@})({@exp2@})=\dfrac{{@var2@}}{{@exp1@}}({@exp1@})({@exp2@})+\dfrac{{@var3@}}{{@exp2@}}({@exp1@})({@exp2@}).\]

Cancelling out, we obtain: Ved stryking får vi:

\[{@expNum1@}={@var2@}({@exp2@})+{@var3@}({@exp1@}).\]

In order to obtain \({@var2@}\), we can substitute \({@var@}=\displaystyle {@ta13_1@}\). From there we can see that \({@var2@}={@ta14_1@}\). Similarly we can obtain \({@var3@}={@ta14_1_1@}\). Finally, the correct fraction is: For å få \({@var2@}\), kan vi sette inn \({@var@}=\displaystyle {@ta13_1@}\). Derfra kan vi se at \({@var2@}={@ta14_1@}\). På samme måte kan vi få \({@var3@}={@ta14_1_1@}\). Til slutt er den riktige brøken:

\[{@ta15_1@}\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

truefeedback.text: You answer is algebraically correct but for this problem you should avoid multiplying out your answer as it complicates the rest of the problem. Svaret ditt er algebraisk riktig, men for denne oppgaven bør du unngå å multiplisere ut svaret, da det kompliserer resten av oppgaven.

You answer is algebraically correct but for this problem you should avoid multiplying out your answer as it complicates the rest of the problem. Svaret ditt er algebraisk riktig, men for denne oppgaven bør du unngå å multiplisere ut svaret, da det kompliserer resten av oppgaven.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Find the partial fractions of: Delbrøksoppspalt:

\(\displaystyle {@WholeExptFact1@}= \) [[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the expression \[\displaystyle {@WholeExptFact1@}.\] The numerator has degree \(1\) and the denominator has degree \(2\), therefore this is a proper fraction. There are \(2\) linear factors in the denominator, therefore Vi får uttrykket \[\displaystyle {@WholeExptFact1@}.\] Telleren har grad \(1\) og nevneren har grad \(2\), derfor er dette en ekte brøk. Det er \(2\) lineære faktorer i nevneren \[\displaystyle {@WholeExptFact1@} = \frac{A}{{@exp11@}} + \frac{B}{{@exp22@}} = \frac{A\cdot ({@exp22@}) + B\cdot ({@exp11@}) }{ ({@exp11@})({@exp22@})} .\]

Equating the top line yields Likestille øvre linjen gir \[ {@expNum11@} = A\cdot ({@exp22@}) + B\cdot ({@exp11@}).\]

Then by substituting values of \(x\) we can solve for \(A, \, B\) and obtain \( A = {@expA@}\) and \( B = {@expB@}.\) Ved å så erstatte verdiene av \(x\) kan vi løse for \(A, \, B\) og få \( A = {@expA@}\) og \( B = {@expB@}.\)

Therefore: Dermed får vi: \[ {@WholeExptFact1@}= {@ta1@}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: Your answer is incorrect. The correct partial fraction is \({@ta1@}\). Svaret ditt er feil. Riktig delbrøk er \({@ta1@}\).

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express \(\displaystyle{@wholeExp1@}\) in partial fractions. Delbrøksoppspalt \(\displaystyle{@wholeExp1@}\).

First factorise the denominator to obtain a factor of the form \(a{@var@}+b\) where \(a,b \in \mathbb{Z}\): Faktoriser først nevneren for å få en faktor på formen \(a{@var@}+b\) der \(a,b \in \mathbb{Z}\):

\({@expDenom1@}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

This is a repeated linear factor which gives rise to two partial fractions of the form: Dette er en gjentatt lineær faktor som gir opphav til to delbrøker på formen:

\[\dfrac{\text{numerator}}{\text{denominator}}=\dfrac{{@var2@}}{{@factor1@}}+\dfrac{{@var3@}}{{@factor2@}}\] \[\dfrac{\text{teller}}{\text{nevner}}=\dfrac{{@var2@}}{{@factor1@}}+\dfrac{{@var3@}}{{@factor2@}}\]

Multiply both sides by your answer above to obtain the equation from which to find \({@var2@}\) and \({@var3@}\): Multipliser begge sider med svaret ovenfor for å få ligningen som du bruker til å finne \({@var2@}\) og \({@var3@}\):


\({@expNum1@}=\) [[input:ans2]][[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]


Now evaluate the constants \({@var2@}\) and \({@var3@}\) by equating coefficients: Evaluer nå konstantene \({@var2@}\) og \({@var3@}\) ved å likestille koeffisienter:

\({@var2@}=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]]; \({@var3@}=\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]]

[[feedback:prt3]] [[feedback:prt4]]

Finally express the answer in partial fractions: Uttrykk til slutt svaret i delbrøker:

\(\displaystyle{@wholeExp1@}=\) [[input:ans5]][[validation:ans5]][[feedback:prt5]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the fraction Vi har fått brøken \(\displaystyle{@wholeExp1@}.\)

We factorise the denominator to obtain: Vi faktoriserer nevneren og får: \({@expDenom1@}= {@ta11@}.\)

There is a repeated linear factor \(({@exp1@})\). Det er en gjentatt lineær faktor \(({@exp1@})\).

Multiplying both sides by the factor \({@ta11@}\) gives \({@ta2@}\). Å multiplisere begge sider med faktoren \({@ta11@}\) gir \({@ta2@}\).

Equating the \({@var@}\) coefficients gives \({@var2@}={@expA@}\). Å likestille \({@var@}\) koeffisientene gir \({@var2@}={@expA@}\).

Equating the free coefficients gives \({@var3@}={@expB@}\). Å likestille de frie koeffisientene gir \({@var3@}={@expB@}\).

Plugging in the repeated factor \({@exp1@}\) and the correct values for \({@var2@}\) and \({@var3@}\) we obtain the partial fractions: Ved å plugge inn den gjentatte faktoren \({@exp1@}\) og de riktige verdiene for \({@var2@}\) og \({@var3@}\) får vi delbrøkene: \[ {@wholeExp1@}= {@ta5@}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

name.text: 3.6.3.3 Exercises_Express in partial fractions (NOT IN QUIZ)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express the following in partial fractions.

  1. \(\displaystyle{{@wholeExp1@}=}\)[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\displaystyle{{@wholeExp2@}=}\)[[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

  3. \(\displaystyle{{@WholeExpFrac3@}=}\)[[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. The repeated linear factor is \({@ta11@}\) and the partial fractions are \({@ta12@}\).


2. The repeated linear factor is \({@ta21@}\) and the partial fractions are \({@ta22@}\).


3. The repeated linear factor is \({@ta31@}\) and the partial fractions are \({@ta32@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express the following in partial fractions. Delbrøksoppspalt brøken:

\(\displaystyle{{@WholeExpFrac3@}=}\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
We are given the expression \[\displaystyle{{@WholeExpFrac3@}}.\] The repeated linear factor is \({@ta31@}\). Therefore the partial fraction decomposition is Vi har uttrykket \[\displaystyle{{@WholeExpFrac3@}}.\] Den repeterte lineære faktoren er \({@ta31@}\). Derfor er den delbrøksnedbrytningen \[ {@WholeExpFrac3@} = \frac{A}{{@exp11@}} + \frac{B}{({@exp11@})^2} = \frac{A\cdot ({@exp11@}) + B}{ ({@exp11@})^2}. \]

Equating the top line yields \[ {@expNum11@} = A\cdot ({@exp11@}) + B.\] Then by substituting values of \(x\) we can solve for \(A, \,B\) and obtain \( A = {@expA@}\) and \(B = {@expB@}.\) Å likestille den øverste linjen gir \[ {@expNum11@} = A\cdot ({@exp11@}) + B.\] Så ved å sette inn verdiene til \(x\) kan vi løse for \(A, \,B\) ) og få \(A = {@expA@}\) og \(B = {@expB@}.\)

Therefore Dermed får vi: \[{@WholeExpFrac3@} = {@ta32@}.\]

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express as partial fractions: Delbrøksoppspalt:

\[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}\]

Please pretend that the quadratic factor cannot be factorised further, it can be, but I can't change the question now. Let's imagine a brighter world where the rest of this makes sense. Lat som om den kvadratiske faktoren ikke kan faktoriseres ytterligere. Det kan faktoriseres ytterligere, men jeg kan ikke endre spørsmålet nå. La oss leve i en lysere verden hvor resten av dette gir mening.

In our brighter world we have I vår lysere verden har vi

\[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}=\dfrac{{@var2*var+var3@}}{{@exp1@}}+\dfrac{{@var4@}}{{@exp2@}}\]

First multiply both sides by Multipliser først begge sider med \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\):

\({@expNum1@}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

Evaluate Evaluer \({@var4@}\):

\({@var4@}=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

Equate coefficients of \({@var@}^2\) and hence find \({@var2@}\), and then substitute any other value for \({@var@}\) (or equate coefficients of \({@var@}\)) to find \({@var3@}\): Likestill koeffisientene til \({@var@}^2\) og finn deretter \({@var2@}\). Substituer nå ut hvilken som helst annen verdi for \({@var@}\) (eller likestill koeffisientene til \( {@var@}\)) for å finne \({@var3@}\):

\({@var2@}=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]]

\({@var3@}=\) [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]][[feedback:prt4]]

Finally express in partial fractions: Uttrykk deretter som delbrøker:

\(\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}=\) [[input:ans5]] [[validation:ans5]][[feedback:prt5]]

generalfeedback.text:
The rational function is proper since the degree of the numerator is \(2\), and this is less than the degree of the denominator which is \(3\). The denominator is the product of a linear and (what we pretend to be) an irreducible quadratic. This lets use determine the antz and the problem is then to find constants \(A,\,B\) and \(C\) so that Den rasjonelle funksjonen er ekte siden graden til telleren er \(2\), og dette er mindre enn graden til nevneren som er \(3\). Nevneren er produktet av en lineær og (det vi later som å være) en ikke reduserbar kvadrat. Problemet er da å finne konstantene \(A,\,B\) og \(C\) slik at
\[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}=\dfrac{{@var2*var+var3@}}{{@exp1@}}+\dfrac{{@var4@}}{{@exp2@}}.\]

We bring everything over a common denominator by multiplying both sides by \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\). This gives:
\[{@expNum1@}={@ta11@}.\] Vi setter alt på en fellesnevner ved å multiplisere begge sider med \(({@exp1@})({@exp2@})\). Dette gir:
\[{@expNum1@}={@ta11@}.\]

The easiest first step is to choose \({@var@}\) so that the linear factor \({@exp2@}=0\), i.e. we take \(\displaystyle{{@var@}={@(rand3*rand4-1)/rand4@}}\). By substituting this in both sides of the equation we find \({@var4@}={@ta12@}\). Det enkle første trinnet er å velge \({@var@}\) slik at den lineære faktoren \({@exp2@}=0\), dvs. vi tar \(\displaystyle{{@var@}={@( rand3*rand4-1)/rand4@}}\). Ved å sette dette inn på begge sider av ligningen finner vi \({@var4@}={@ta12@}\).

Since there are no linear factors there are no real values we can substitute to eliminate all but one of the unknown constants. We can equate the coefficients of \({@var@}^2\) easily enough however, and we find \({@diff(diff(expNum1,x),x)/2@}={@ratsimp(diff(diff(ta11,x),x)/2)@}\). We already have that \({@var4@}={@ta12@}\) and substitution gives \({@var2@}={@ta13@}\).

If we substitute any other value for \({@var@}\), an easy option may be \({@var@}=0\)  which is the same as  equating the constant of the left and right side of the equation. In that case we find \({@ratsimp(expNum1 + var^2*diff(diff(expNum1,x),x)/2 - var*diff(expNum1,x))@}={@ratsimp(ta11 + x^2*diff(diff(ta11,x),x)/2 - x*diff(ta11,x))@}\). Using the values we found already this simplifies further to give \({@var3@}={@ta14@}\).

We can piece everything together to see that \[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}={@ta15@}.\]

I should note that since the quadratic is not irreducible we should go another step to write the term with the quadratic denominator in partial fractions. There's nothing wrong with the solution in this way, but one would never simplify in two stages. Assume the quadratic was irreducible and this is all fine. Siden det ikke er noen lineære faktorer, er det ingen reelle verdier vi kan erstatte for å eliminere alle unntatt én av de ukjente konstantene. Vi kan imidlertid likestille koeffisientene til \({@var@}^2\) lett nok, og vi finner \({@diff(diff(expNum1,x),x)/2@}={@ratsimp(diff( diff(ta11,x),x)/2)@}\). Vi vet allerede at \({@var4@}={@ta12@}\) og substitusjonen gir \({@var2@}={@ta13@}\).

Hvis vi substituerer noen annen verdi for \({@var@}\), kan et enkelt alternativ være \({@var@}=0\)  som er det samme som å sette likhetstegn mellom konstanten til venstre og høyre side av ligningen. I så fall finner vi \({@ratsimp(expNum1 + var^2*diff(diff(expNum1,x),x)/2 - var*diff(expNum1,x))@}={@ratsimp(ta11 + x ^2*diff(diff(ta11,x),x)/2 - x*diff(ta11,x))@}\). Ved å bruke verdiene vi allerede fant, forenkles dette ytterligere og gir \({@var3@}={@ta14@}\).

Vi kan sette alt sammen for å se at \[\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{({@exp1@})({@exp2@})}={@ta15@}.\]

Jeg bør merke meg at siden kvadratet er reduserbar, bør vi gå en annen trinn for å skrive begrepet med andregradsnevneren som delbrøker. Det er ikke noe galt med løsningen på denne måten, men man ville aldri forenklet i to trinn. Anta at kvadratet ikke var reduserbart, og at alt er greit.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: The valuew of \(C\) is incorrect. You can choose a value of \(x\) so that the linear factor \({@exp2@}=0.\) Verdien av \(C\) er feil. Du kan velge verdien \(x\) slik at den lineære faktoren \({@exp2@}=0.\)

truefeedback.text: You calculated wrong values for \(A\) but wrote the partial fraction in the desired form. Du regnet ut feil verdier for \(A\), men skrev delbrøken i ønsket form.
You calculated wrong values for \(B\) but wrote the partial fraction in the desired form. Du regnet ut feil verdier for \(B\), men skrev delbrøken i ønsket form.
You calculated wrong values for \(C\) but wrote the partial fraction in the desired form. Du regnet ut feil verdier for \(C\), men skrev delbrøken i ønsket form.
You calculated wrong values for \(A,B,C\) but wrote the partial fraction in the desired form. Du regnet ut feil verdier for \(A,B,C\), men skrev delbrøken i ønsket form.

name.text: 3.6.4.3 Express each fraction as sum of partial fractions (NOT IN QUIZ)

questiontext.text:
Exercise

Express each of the following as the sum of its partial fractions.

  1. \(\dfrac{{@expNum1@}}{{@expDenom1@}}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\dfrac{{@expNum2@}}{{@expDenom2@}}=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. First, by multiplying both sides by \(({@exp11@})({@exp12@})\) we obtain \({@ta11@}\). By letting \({@var@}={@ta1X@}\) we find that the correct value of \({@var4@}\) is \({@ta12@}\). By equating the coefficients of \({@var@}^2\) we find \({@var2@}={@ta13@}\). If we substitute any other value for \({@var@}\) (or equate coefficients of \({@var@}\)) we find \({@var3@}={@ta14@}\). Finally, the partial fractions are \(\displaystyle {@ta15@}\).

  2. First, by multiplying both sides by \(({@exp21@})({@exp22@})\) we obtain \({@ta21@}\). By letting \({@var@}={@ta2X@}\) we find that the correct value of \({@var4@}\) is \({@ta22@}\). By equating the coefficients of \({@var@}^2\) we find \({@var2@}={@ta23@}\). If we substitute any other value for \({@var@}\) (or equate coefficients of \({@var@}\)) we find \({@var3@}={@ta24@}\). Finally, the partial fractions are \(\displaystyle {@ta25@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.

falsefeedback.text: The sum of the partial fractions is \({@ta1@}\).
The sum of the partial fractions is \({@ta2@}\).

questiontext.text:
Exercise Øving

Express each of the following improper fractions in terms of partial fractions. Uttrykk hver av de følgende uekte brøkene som en delbrøk.

  1. \(\dfrac{{@num1@}}{{@denom1@}}=\) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

  2. \(\dfrac{{@num2@}}{{@denom2@}}=\) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]][[feedback:prt2]]

  3. \(\dfrac{{@num3@}}{{@denom3@}}=\) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]][[feedback:prt3]]

generalfeedback.text:
1. Notice that: Merk at: \(\dfrac{{@num1@}}{{@denom1@}} = \displaystyle {@feedb1@}.\)

    After multiplying both sides by the denominator and equating the coefficients, you will obtain the partial fractions \(\displaystyle{@ta1@}\). Etter å ha multiplisert begge sider med nevneren og likestilt koeffisientene, får du delbrøkene \(\displaystyle{@ta1@}\).

  2. Notice that: Merk at: \(\dfrac{{@num2@}}{{@denom2@}}= \displaystyle {@feedb2@}.\)

    After multiplying both sides by the denominator and equating the coefficients, you will obtain the partial fractions Etter å ha multiplisert begge sider med nevneren og likestilt koeffisientene, vil du få delbrøkene \(\displaystyle{@ta2@}\).

  3. Notice that: Merk at: \(\dfrac{{@num3@}}{{@denom3@}}=\displaystyle {@feedb3@}.\)

    After multiplying both sides by the denominator and equating the coefficients, you will obtain the partial fractions Etter å ha multiplisert begge sider med nevneren og likestilt koeffisientene, vil du få delbrøkene \(\displaystyle{@ta3@}\).

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

prtincorrect.text: Incorrect answer.
